title: ISO 10015-Based Virtual Training Design and Development Strategies: Application to Social Learning Environments and Civic Competency Enhancement

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational educational development theories, experience with digital learning tools, understanding of social learning environments, and basic concepts of civic competencies and cultural diversity
context.additional_context: Emphasizing practical competencies applicable to real educational development projects. Optimizing content organization for mobile device utilization in BYOD environments. Designing collaborative learning activities considering cultural diversity. Recommending citizen-participatory learning scenarios for solving community issues.

learning_goals: Explain the procedure for applying the ISO 10015 framework for educational needs analysis from the perspectives of social context and cultural diversity
Establish a strategy for linking educational objectives with assessment tools in the design of virtual training programs, focusing on civic competency development and social relationship formation

Learners design a content development method utilizing three social interaction elements (comments, sharing, real-time feedback) in a mobile microlearning environment, submit a prototype achieving over 80% engagement rate (click/reaction rate) with 10 learners, and evaluate collaborative learning effects
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
